header.title: ESOTERIC EXTENSION OF TAROT TO DEVELOP SUPERSENSORY POWERS LESSON 9

central_thesis: Human beings are “sons and daughters of God” possessing inherent divine creative potential, and the path to developing supersensory powers and fulfilling this potential lies in consciously mastering one's own consciousness, learning to “see” reality, and transmuting subconscious energies through disciplined application of esoteric principles, primarily derived from Tarot and Qabalah.

structure_content.summary: The lesson begins by emphasizing the importance of defining one's will and working towards its fulfillment, asserting that God creates reality from consciousness and humans, as divine offspring, possess this same creative capacity, albeit in a nascent form.

structure_content.chapter_title: Spiritual Development as Analogous to Infant Growth
structure_content.summary: Spiritual evolution is likened to a baby learning basic functions like walking, talking, and seeing. These abilities are not innate but acquired through persistent effort and experience, demonstrating that spiritual powers also require training and practice, often involving initial struggles or “bruising.”

"Learning how to see" is identified as a crucial secret of the Great Work. Tarot Key 15, The Devil (associated with the Hebrew letter Ayin, meaning "eye"), symbolizes this concept. The perception of "hell" or "grotesqueness" in the phenomenal universe is attributed to a lack of proper spiritual vision and creative mastery.

Our consciousness actively constructs our reality. An "unlovely" reality reflects our inability to build properly or to revere our creations. Developing true "perspective" involves seeing beyond surface appearances to grasp reality, requiring both conscious and visual interpretation. This interpretive ability is fundamental to the Great Work.

Interpreting reality demands courage. Key 8, Strength, linked to the Hebrew letter Teth, is attributed to the "secret of all spiritual activities." This involves bravely pursuing one's will, cultivating interpretive skills to discern unrealistic aims, and continuously engaging in conscious creation to realize one's divine birthrights.

Spiritual powers, though inherent, must be taught by God through a hierarchical chain of transmitters. This divine grace necessitates learning to discriminate between genuine spiritual guidance and deceptive influences.
The benefits of spiritual development are described as profound, enhancing one's appreciation and experience of life, akin to a dancer's grace or sharpened sensory perceptions.

structure_content.chapter_title: The Unity of Creation and the "One Dreamer"
structure_content.summary: Consciousness is the ultimate creator, with thought being creation. The physical universe is a slower manifestation of conscious thought. The text posits "only one dream and One Dreamer," emphasizing that each individual consciousness is an inseparable "cell in the brain of the Dreamer," part of God's total consciousness.

The concepts of "good and evil" are reframed as mere interpretations of the cosmic process. Pain and struggle are seen as integral to the "training ground," fostering strength, spiritual progress, and insight.

structure_content.chapter_title: Materialism, Pseudo-spiritualism, and the Body as a Magical Instrument
structure_content.summary: Both extreme materialism and pseudo-spiritualism (which despises the physical world) are deemed nonsensical by Qabalah. The physical body and environment are viewed as a "magical instrument" through which God experiences the universe, requiring reverence and proper care.

structure_content.chapter_title: Responsibility, Liberation, and Key 12 (The Hanged Man)
structure_content.summary: Aspirants bear a heightened responsibility to themselves, humanity, and life to cultivate conscious creative ability for global improvement. Key 12, The Hanged Man, is presented as representing liberation, a goal attained through disciplined, persistent effort (likened to a "turtle" over a "hare").

structure_content.chapter_title: The Nature of Growth and Perspective
structure_content.summary: The text differentiates between a neurotic (knows truth but is unhappy) and a psychotic (believes falsehoods happily), urging students to appreciate the miraculousness of basic life functions. This highlights the importance of correct perspective and genuine happiness in understanding reality.

structure_content.chapter_title: Key 8 (Strength) and the Transmutation of Libido
structure_content.summary: Tarot Key 8, Strength, illustrates the process of transmuting the subconscious and controlling the libido (defined as the sex drive and the entire subconscious field). This control is achieved through "love" and disciplined effort, symbolized by the red roses.

structure_content.chapter_title: The Interplay of Tarot Keys: 1, 8, and 15
structure_content.summary: The lecture explains the relationship between Key 1 (The Magician) as the cause, Key 8 (Strength) as the agency or law, and Key 15 (The Devil) as the resulting condition. The horizontal figure-eight above the woman in Key 8 signifies its connection to the power of Key 1. The attention of the Magician (Key 1) applied to the "libido, the lion, the vital soul of subconsciousness" (Key 8) determines the positive or negative aspects of the results seen in Key 15.

structure_content.chapter_title: Tarot and Qabalah as Universal Language
structure_content.summary: Tarot and Qabalah are described as a universal language of symbols that communicates with the deeper, untrained parts of the self. Conscious training in these systems enables individuals to become conscious co-creators with God.

Controlling subconscious energy involves a combination of discrimination and love, exemplified by Key 8 connecting Chesed (Mercy) and Geburah (Severity) on the Tree of Life. True love includes discipline. Negative emotions like irritation, hatred, and remorse must be transmuted, not suppressed, a process greatly facilitated by humor and self-awareness, which reduce ego and self-reproach.

structure_content.chapter_title: The Significance of Current Spiritual Evolution
structure_content.summary: This era is presented as a crucial time for spiritual evolution, with an influx of souls seeking another chance. Aspirants engaged in this intensive esoteric training hold a privilege and responsibility to lead and aid others in crossing a spiritual barrier through their own development of insight and strength.

The lesson concludes with a directive for dedicated and responsible application of the techniques involving the 22 major trumps of the Tarot to develop extrasensory perception and power, promising enjoyment in the process.

key_concepts.definition: The ability of humans to manifest reality through thought and imagination, mirroring the divine creative process, as 'sons and daughters of God.'
The spiritual journey of self-realization and mastery, involving learning to 'see' accurately and 'create properly,' leading to control over inner and outer worlds.
A profound spiritual faculty, beyond physical sight, to perceive and interpret the underlying reality and spiritual laws governing existence, symbolized by Key 15 (The Devil) and Ayin.
The ability to accurately weigh, measure, and interpret reality using both conscious insight and physical perception, seeing beyond superficial appearances.

Encompassing the sex drive and the entire subconscious field, viewed as a raw energy that must be controlled and transmuted through love and discipline for spiritual development (as per Key 8, Strength).
The alchemical process of transforming lower, chaotic, or negative psychological energies (e.g., rage, hatred) into higher, constructive expressions, often facilitated by self-awareness and humor.

The metaphysical principle that all existence originates from a single, unified divine consciousness, with individual consciousnesses functioning as integral, inseparable 'cells' within this greater whole.
Symbolic representations of universal cosmic laws and psychological processes, serving as practical tools for understanding, training consciousness, and developing extrasensory perception and power.

An esoteric system providing a structural and linguistic framework (e.g., Tree of Life, Hebrew letters) for comprehending divine dynamics, the process of creation, and the pathways of spiritual evolution.

practical_system.description: The system outlined aims to develop "supersensory powers" through the conscious application of esoteric principles, primarily derived from Tarot and Qabalah. It functions as a path of self-mastery, guiding the individual to become a conscious co-creator with God by understanding, directing, and evolving their own consciousness and "libido" (subconscious energies). This developmental process is likened to human physical and mental growth, necessitating persistent effort, rigorous self-observation, and the transmutation of negative psychological traits into constructive ones.
tools: Qabalah (Tree of Life, Hebrew letters, associated concepts)
Consciousness (as the primary creative and transformative force)
Self-observation/Introspection (for understanding inner states and patterns)
Discrimination (for discerning truth, true teachers, and effective actions)
Love (as a transformative force for controlling and transmuting subconscious energies)
Humor (as an aid to transmute negativity and maintain perspective)
rituals: Practicing conscious creation and manifesting desired outcomes.
Utilizing Tarot Major Trumps for extrasensory perception and power development.
Applying Qabalistic principles (e.g., Tree of Life connections) for spiritual understanding and energy balance.
Engaging in self-reflection and introspection to identify and transmute negative emotions and subconscious patterns.

relevant_quotes.text: Let us consider a few of the steps that we have taken in this series. We began by impressing upon you the importance of finding out what it is you want to be and to do, because without being, without doing, you go nowhere. It is vital to decide what you want.
God creates from the web of His own consciousness, and this is the theory of all occult and metaphysical teachings. It is no theory to those who have engaged in contemplation.
Learning how to see is one of the secrets of the Great Work.
When we have not yet learned how to see, what we see looks like hell.

The phenomenal universe and our experiences in it are no different from the baby learning to walk. The whole point is to know how to see and to analyze correctly, to learn what happens in our creative powers, in order to make better and better use of them!
Remember that there is only one dream and One Dreamer. That one dream and One Dreamer are not separate from us. We are each a cell in the brain of the Dreamer.
To the problem of good and evil we return the answer, 'There is no such thing as good or evil.'
Qabalah teaches that materialism is largely nonsense, and its pseudo-spiritualism equally nonsensical.

The Tarot keys are like words that must be strung into phrases or sentences. Tarot and Qabalah are the universal language, the language of symbol which speaks to the part of you that knows it even when you have not been trained consciously.

Transmutation becomes simple when we have humor, because we do not feel the need to mourn in sackcloth and ashes, because we realize that although we thought we had a loving nature, subconsciously we have been hating, perhaps unconsciously wishing to kill.

critical_analysis.relevance: This work is highly relevant to Western Esotericism, particularly Hermetic Qabalah and Tarot studies, offering a practical and deeply psychological framework for personal and spiritual transformation. It integrates microcosm-macrocosm principles, emphasizing individual responsibility in co-creation and spiritual evolution, which are central tenets in many occult traditions. Its focus on the transmutation of lower energies through conscious effort and love aligns with core alchemical and magical practices.
critical_analysis.target_audience: The target audience comprises dedicated aspirants and students of Western Esotericism, Qabalah, and Tarot, specifically those engaged in self-development, conscious creation, and the pursuit of supersensory powers. It is designed for individuals committed to a disciplined path of spiritual growth, willing to engage in profound introspection and apply esoteric principles actively to their daily lives.
